title: Instructional Design Linking Language Proficiency and Creativity: Strengthening Competencies of Social Sector Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Focuses on strengthening creative problem-solving competencies through digital environment-based project implementation

learning_goals: Learners can explain the correlation between language maturity and creativity by analyzing online test results.
Learners can creatively interpret learner language proficiency diagnostic data using regression analysis techniques.
Learners can apply language maturity improvement strategies to creative social studies classes through project-based assignments.

resources: Guilford's Alternative Uses Test (CAT)-Based Online Assessment Tool
Access to AI Text Generation Tools (e.g., ChatGPT)
Social Studies Creative Lesson Case Database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
